Literature Review: WNK kinases are a group of evolutionarily ancient kinases with diverse physiological roles, and recent studies have shed light on their regulation by various ions and osmotic pressures. The discovery of WNKs as chloride-sensitive kinases has been a significant breakthrough in understanding their physiological functions. This review aims to summarize the current knowledge on the regulation of WNKs by chloride, potassium, and osmotic pressure, and discuss their interdependent relationship in cell volume regulation. We will also review the recent demonstration of potassium regulation of WNKs and speculate on possible physiological roles. Finally, we will discuss the structural and mechanistic aspects of intracellular ion and osmotic pressure regulation of WNKs.

The WNK kinases: a family of ion transport regulators
Cloning and characterization of the WNK1 and WNK4 kinases
The role of WNK kinases in the regulation of ion transport
